data.title: Tampa Downtown Partnership
data.text:
UT Baseball vs. Rollins

Begins Noon

University of Tampa

The Spartans grab the gloves and bats to defend home turf in a doubleheader against the visiting Tars. UT Baseball vs. Rollins.

Movies @ The Library

Begins 3pm

John F. Germany Public Library

Head to the library for an intimate showing of Collateral Beauty, starring Will Smith. Retreating from life after a tragedy, a man questions the universe by writing to Love, Time and Death. Receiving unexpected answers, he begins to see how these things interlock and how even loss can reveal moments of meaning and beauty. Movies @ The Library.

Brews & Bites Food Truck Rally

Begins 6pm

Sail Pavilion

On the second Friday of each month The Sail hosts a Brews & Bites Food Truck Rally. A rolling celebration of food and fun, Brews & Bites features live entertainment and a fleet of Tampa’s favorite food trucks. Brews & Bites Food Truck Rally.

Sebastian Maniscalco: Why Would You Do That?

Begins 7pm

Straz Center for the Performing Arts

Saying what we’re all thinking has always been Sebastian Maniscalco’s specialty. Except when he says it, it’s a whole lot funnier, and that has fans across North America showing up in droves for his shows and millions tuning in for his network specials. Sebastian Maniscalco.

The Weeknd

Begins 7:30pm

Amalie Arena

The Grammy Award®-winning, multi-platinum selling artist brings his lineup of top hits to Downtown Tampa. Do not miss the chance to see The Weeknd on his first-ever world tour. Get your tickets, sing along to your favorite songs, and get dancing! The Weeknd.

The Dinner

Shows at 7:30pm and 10:30pm

Tampa Theatre

A riveting, disturbing psychological thriller about the lengths we will travel to protect our families, and the people we will sell out to satisfy our own ambition. The Dinner.

The American Songbook: Then and Now – The Florida Orchestra

Begins 8pm

Straz Center for the Performing Arts

Nobody loves a piano like Tony DeSare. The jazzy singer-songwriter-pianist has a style that’s all his own. From Sinatra to Prince from Mercer to McCartney, he spans the generations for marvelous music from America’s great songwriters, with hits like Kiss, Come Fly with Me, The Times They Are a Changin’ and Great Balls of Fire. The American Songbook: Then and Now.

SeaGrapes Wine and Food Festival

Begins 8pm

The Florida Aquarium

Immerse yourself in a wine and food festival unlike any other! Enjoy wonderful wines and sample fantastic foods while strolling among some of the most amazing animals and plants from around the world. SeaGrapes Wine and Food Festival.

Avenue Q – SOLD OUT

Begins 8pm

Stageworks Theatre

A laugh-out-loud musical that tells the timeless story of a recent college grad named Princeton who moves into a shabby New York apartment all the way out on Avenue Q. There, he meets a collection of colorful characters who help him finally discover his purpose in life! Avenue Q.

Tampa Train Day

10am to 4pm

Historic Tampa Union Station

Celebrate railroads past, present and future at this free, family-friendly event featuring model train displays, history exhibits, live music and presentations about trains. Tampa Train Day.

Art Spot

11am to 2pm

Tampa Museum of Art

Join us and let your imagination run free as our art facilitators introduce exhibition-specific methods of art making filled with fun and creativity for you and yours. Art Spot.

Farmacy Vegan Kitchen + Bakery Grand Opening

Begins 1pm

Duckweed Market

Gather around for the grand opening of a new vegan kitchen and bakery. This is a great opportunity to try some tasty vegan treats. Farmacy Vegan Kitchen + Bakery Grand Opening.

Stop the Presses

Begins 1:30pm

Tampa Theatre

This film chronicles the last press run and eventual demise of the Tampa Tribune. Filmmaker Deborah Kerr and her crew were filming a day in the life of a newspaper when the company unraveled and its owners sold the 121-year-old institution to a longtime local competitor, thus ending the bay area’s newspaper war and decades-long careers for hundreds of reporters, photographers, editors, and pressmen. Stop the Presses.

Masters of Dance: Balanchine and Robbins plus Petipa’s Don Quixote Suite

Shows at 2pm and 7pm

Straz Center for the Performing Arts

In this extraordinary concert, NGB dancers perform the work of not one legend, but three choreography legends – Jerome Robbins, George Balanchine and Marius Petipa. Masters of Dance.

Avenue Q

Shows at 3pm and 8pm (8pm show is sold out)

Stageworks Theatre

A laugh-out-loud musical that tells the timeless story of a recent college grad named Princeton who moves into a shabby New York apartment all the way out on Avenue Q. There, he meets a collection of colorful characters who help him finally discover his purpose in life! Avenue Q.

The Dinner

Shows at 4:30pm and 11:30pm

Tampa Theatre

A riveting, disturbing psychological thriller about the lengths we will travel to protect our families, and the people we will sell out to satisfy our own ambition. The Dinner.

Mother’s Day Brunch Buffet

10am to 2pm

Bizou Brasserie

Make your favorite lady feel special this Mother’s Day with a brunch buffet filled with local flavors and the freshest ingredients. The only thing more memorable than the flavors tingling your taste buds will be the complimentary family photo on the historic front steps. Mother’s Day Brunch Buffet.

Mother’s Day at the History Center

10am to 5pm

Tampa Bay History Center

Mom can experience all the fun of the History Center, including “Finding Fairyland: Rediscovering Tampa’s Lost Themepark,” for free on Mother’s Day. Mother’s Day at the History Center.

Mother’s Day Brunch & Dinner Cruise

Begins 10:30am

Yacht Starship Dining Cruise

Treat mom to the spectacular Mother’s Day she deserves with a brunch or dinner cruise. The entire family will love dining on freshly prepared cuisine while taking in the views on the sparkling waters of Tampa Bay! Mother’s Day Brunch & Dinner Cruise.

Mother’s Day Jazz in the Park

1pm to 7pm

Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park

Celebrate Mother’s Day with the sounds of smooth jazz from David Sanborn and Ben Tankard at this free event. There will be a children’s village filled with arts and crafts, face painting, and more. Mother’s Day Jazz in the Park.

Masters of Dance: Balanchine and Robbins plus Petipa’s Don Quixote Suite

Shows at 2pm and 7pm

Straz Center for the Performing Arts

In this extraordinary concert, NGB dancers perform the work of not one legend, but three choreography legends – Jerome Robbins, George Balanchine and Marius Petipa. Masters of Dance.

Avenue Q

Shows at 3pm and 7pm

Stageworks Theatre

A laugh-out-loud musical that tells the timeless story of a recent college grad named Princeton who moves into a shabby New York apartment all the way out on Avenue Q. There, he meets a collection of colorful characters who help him finally discover his purpose in life! Avenue Q.

The Dinner

Shows at 3:15pm and 6:15pm

Tampa Theatre

A riveting, disturbing psychological thriller about the lengths we will travel to protect our families, and the people we will sell out to satisfy our own ambition. The Dinner.
